main event: Observers observed three dim, white circular objects in a V-formation moving southwest near Elko, Nevada on 2 May 1949.
interesting points: The objects were about 1/4 inch across to the naked eye and estimated to be 30 feet in diameter at a distance., The estimated speed of the objects was between 250 to 300 miles per hour., The observer was an Airplane Communicator and was considered truthful and reliable., The objects were visible for approximately two minutes before disappearing with no visible exhaust or sound., No other witnesses could be located despite investigations.
sighted object: three dim, circular objects in a V-formation
witness description: Airplane Communicator for the Civil Aeronautics Administration, observed the objects while working on his car.
